title: Conspire

description: Conspire is a free and open-source application for encrypted, decentralized chat and file sharing.

title: DarkFi
subtitle: Free and open-source anonymous P2P ecosystem

title: Darkice
subtitle: live audio streamer for GNU/Linux
description: Darkice records audio from an audio interface, encodes it and sends it to a streaming server.

title: Devuan
subtitle: GNU Linux distribution
description: Debian fork without systemd bugs: stable, secure, simple and fast. Regular updates since 2016 thanks to steady community driven development.

title: Dynebolic
subtitle: Free & Live Creative Multimedia
description: Dynebolic is a 100% Free Software Operating System for multimedia production, recommended by the Free Software Foundation.

title: FreeJ
subtitle: Free Video Mixer
description: Video mixer for live video manipulation in dance theater, veejaying, medical visualization and TV. Developed in 2001 by Jaromil, used in many performances around the world, it was the first free and open source live-coding software.

title: Harvest
subtitle: manage large collections of files and dirs

title: HasciiCam
subtitle: ASCII art for the masses
description: HasciiCam makes it possible to have live ASCII art videos on the web.

title: Jaromail

description: Jaro Mail is a suite of console email tools to archive mails without storing them online. Built following reliable open source standards.

title: MacTomb

title: Social Wallet
subtitle: Design and manage currencies in a simple and secure way.

title: sup
subtitle: A “small is beautiful” tool for unix privilege escalation

title: Tomb

description: Tomb is a system to make strong encryption easy for everyday use.

title: Yubiswitch

title: Zenbridge
